title: Indoor air concentrations of PM2.5 quartz fiber filter-collected ionic PFAS and emissions to outdoor air: findings from the IPA campaign
content:
Environ. Sci.: Processes Impacts, 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4EM00359D, Paper
Naomi Y. Chang, Clara M. A. Eichler, Daniel E. Amparo, Jiaqi Zhou, Karsten Baumann, Elaine A. Cohen Hubal, Jason D. Surratt, Glenn C. Morrison, Barbara J. Turpin
Indoor concentrations of total PFAS were âˆ¼3.4 times higher than outdoor concentrations and indoor-to-outdoor emission rates suggest home emissions may contribute to ambient concentrations of some PFAS away from major point sources.
